verses.verse: For even what was made glorious had no glory in this respect, because of the glory that excels.
For if what is passing away was glorious, what remains is much more glorious.
Therefore, since we have such hope, (Acts 4:13, 29; 2 Cor. 7:4; Eph. 6:19) we use great boldness of speech—
unlike Moses, (Ex. 34:33-35; 2 Cor. 3:7) who put a veil over his face so that the children of Israel could not look steadily at (Rom. 10:4; (Gal. 3:23)) the end of what was passing away.

But (Is. 6:10; 29:10; Acts 28:26; Rom. 11:7, 8; 2 Cor. 4:4) their minds were blinded. For until this day the same veil remains unlifted in the reading of the Old Testament, because the veil is taken away in Christ.
But even to this day, when Moses is read, a veil lies on their heart.
Nevertheless (Ex. 34:34; Rom. 11:23) when one turns to the Lord, (Is. 25:7) the veil is taken away.
Now ((1 Cor. 15:45)) the Lord is the Spirit; and where the Spirit of the Lord is, there is (John 8:32; Gal. 5:1, 13) liberty.

But we all, with unveiled face, beholding (1 Cor. 13:12) as in a mirror ((2 Cor. 4:4, 6)) the glory of the Lord, ((Rom. 8:29, 30)) are being transformed into the same image from glory to glory, just as by the Spirit of the Lord.
The Light of Christ’s Gospel Therefore, since we have this ministry, (1 Cor. 7:25) as we have received mercy, we (Luke 18:1; 2 Cor. 4:16; Gal. 6:9; Eph. 3:13; 2 Thess. 3:13) do not lose heart.

But we have renounced the hidden things of shame, not walking in craftiness nor handling the word of God deceitfully, but by manifestation of the truth (2 Cor. 5:11) commending ourselves to every man’s conscience in the sight of God.
But even if our gospel is veiled, ((1 Cor. 1:18); 2 Cor. 2:15) it is veiled to those who are perishing,

whose minds (John 12:31; (Eph. 6:12)) the god of this age (John 12:40) has blinded, who do not believe, lest ((2 Cor. 3:8, 9)) the light of the gospel of the glory of Christ, ((John 1:18); Phil. 2:6; Col. 1:15; Heb. 1:3) who is the image of God, should shine on them.
(1 Cor. 1:13) For we do not preach ourselves, but Christ Jesus the Lord, and (1 Cor. 9:19) ourselves your bondservants for Jesus’ sake.

For it is the God (Gen. 1:3) who commanded light to shine out of darkness, who has (Is. 9:2; Mal. 4:2; Luke 1:78; 2 Pet. 1:19) shone in our hearts to give the light of the knowledge of the glory of God in the face of Jesus Christ.
Cast Down but Unconquered But we have this treasure in earthen vessels, (Judg. 7:2; 1 Cor. 2:5) that the excellence of the power may be of God and not of us.
We are (2 Cor. 1:8; 7:5) hard-pressed on every side, yet not crushed; we are perplexed, but not in despair;
persecuted, but not (Ps. 129:2; (Heb. 13:5)) forsaken; (Ps. 37:24) struck down, but not destroyed—
